Please verify: 1) The hostname/IP address is correct, 2) The CCU is powered on and reachable, 3) Username and password are correct (case-sensitive), 4) The user has admin privileges on the CCU, 5) No firewall is blocking the connection.
error.invalid_auth: Authentication failed for CCU [{invalid_items}]. Please verify: 1) Username and password are correct (case-sensitive), 2) The user has admin privileges on the CCU, 3) Password only contains allowed characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and .!$():;#-

data_description.callback_host: IP address for CCU callbacks. Leave empty for auto-detection.
data_description.callback_port_xml_rpc: Port for XML-RPC callbacks. Leave empty for automatic assignment.
data_description.listen_on_all_ip: Enable if Home Assistant runs in Docker or a VM. Required when HA's IP differs from the host IP.
data_description.mqtt_enabled: Enable MQTT to support callbacks for CCU-Jack and CUxD
data_description.mqtt_prefix: The MQTT prefix used for the CCU-Jack bridge
data_description.optional_settings: Enable optional settings. Used for analytics and debugging. Should not be used during normal operations.
data_description.program_markers: Comma separated list of markers for programs to enable fetching. To reset, the value must be set to a space.
data_description.sub_devices_enabled: Creates separate entities for each channel of multi-channel devices (e.g., each button of a remote).
data_description.sysvar_markers: Comma separated list of markers for system variables to enable fetching, To reset, the value must be set to a space.

data_description.instance_name:
Name of the HA instance.
 If you want to connect to the same CCU instance from multiple HA installations this instance_name must be unique on every HA instance
data_description.password: Case sensitive. Allowed characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and .!$():;#-
data_description.username: Case sensitive. User must have administrator role

state.frequency_lowon_longoff_highon_longoff: Low on-long off, high on-long off

central_degraded.title: CCU connection degraded

central_failed.description:
The CCU connection for **{instance_name}** has failed.

Reason: {reason}

Automatic recovery attempts have been exhausted. Please check:
- CCU is powered on and reachable
- Network connectivity
- CCU logs for errors

Reload the integration to retry.
central_failed.title: CCU connection failed

central_failed_internal.description:
The CCU connection for **{instance_name}** has failed due to an internal CCU error.

Interface: {interface_id}

The CCU reported an internal error. Please:
- Check CCU system logs for errors
- Consider restarting the CCU
- Update CCU firmware if available

Reload the integration to retry.
central_failed_internal.title: CCU internal error

central_failed_network.description:
The CCU connection for **{instance_name}** has failed due to a network connectivity issue.

Interface: {interface_id}

Please check:
- CCU is powered on and reachable on the network
- Network cables and Wi-Fi connectivity
- Firewall settings allowing XML-RPC traffic
- CCU network configuration

Reload the integration to retry.
central_failed_network.title: CCU network connection failed

central_failed_timeout.description:
The CCU connection for **{instance_name}** has failed due to connection timeouts.

Interface: {interface_id}

The CCU may be overloaded or experiencing performance issues. Please check:
- CCU CPU and memory usage
- CCU is not executing long-running operations
- Network latency between Home Assistant and CCU

Reload the integration to retry.
central_failed_timeout.title: CCU connection timeout

data_description.device_name: Enter a name for the device. This will be used as the device name in the CCU and Home Assistant. Leave empty to keep the default name.

set_name.description:
A new device with address **{address}** was detected on interface **{interface_id}**.

Enter a name and confirm to add it to Home Assistant.
set_name.title: Add delayed device {address}

fetch_data_failed.description:
Failed to fetch device data from interface **{interface_id}**.

Unable to fetch data using a Rega script. This indicates an issue on your CCU.

The integration will use a fallback method, which may lead to higher DutyCycle during startup for this interface.
fetch_data_failed.title: Failed to fetch device data

interface_not_reachable.description:
No connection to interface {interface_id}.

This Integration tries an automatic reconnect.

Check the Home Assistant log files for more details
interface_not_reachable.title: Interface {interface_id} not reachable

pending_pong_mismatch.description:
There is a mismatch between send ping events and received pong events for HA instance {instance_name}.

Possible reasons:
 - You are running multiple instances of HA with the same instance name configured for this integration. Re-add one instance! Otherwise this HA instance will not receive update events from your CCU.
 - Something is stuck on the CCU or hasn't been cleaned up. Therefore, try a restart.
 - Your setup is misconfigured and HA is not able to receive events from the CCU
pending_pong_mismatch.title: Pending Pong mismatch on interface {interface_id}

ping_pong_mismatch.description:
A ping-pong mismatch was detected on interface **{interface_id}**.

**Mismatch type:** {mismatch_type}
**Mismatch count:** {mismatch_count}

Possible reasons:
 - You are running multiple instances of Home Assistant with the same instance name configured for this integration. Re-add one instance! Otherwise this Home Assistant instance will not receive update events from your CCU.
 - Something is stuck on the CCU or hasn't been cleaned up. Try restarting the CCU.
 - Your setup is misconfigured and Home Assistant is not able to receive events from the CCU.
ping_pong_mismatch.title: Ping-pong mismatch on interface {interface_id}

unknown_pong_mismatch.description:
There are unknown pong events observed for HA instance {instance_name}.

Possible reasons:
 - You are running multiple instances of HA with the same instance name configured for this integration. Re-add one instance! Otherwise this HA instance will not receive update events from your CCU.
 - Something is stuck on the CCU or hasn't been cleaned up. Therefore, try a restart.
 - Your setup is misconfigured and HA is not able to receive events from the CCU
unknown_pong_mismatch.title: Unknown Pong mismatch on interface {interface_id}

xmlrpc_server_receives_no_events.description:
Callback for {interface_id} has not received events for {seconds_since_last_event}s.

This Integration tries an automatic reconnect
xmlrpc_server_receives_no_events.title: XmlRPC-Server received no events
